--- In junit@y..., emeade@g... wrote:
> I've played around with the Tools Integration API and come up with:
> 
> http://www.geekfarm.org/emeade/junit/VajJunit.zip

Things aren't as dark as I thought, as David Farber pointed out to me 
(I love pairing).  Here is the updated readme:

----

This is experimental software, use at your own risk, you have been 
warned.

Known Problems:

Classpath.  I haven't been able to figure out how to get the 
TestRunner to use the Vaj Classpath.

There are two work arounds:

1.  Export your tests into the junit directory under ide\tools.  It's 
a pain, I've experimented with Worspace.setClassPath, which has been 
resulting in a java.lang.InteralError when trying to load the test.  
Exporting your tests is the only way right clicking on a package or 
class will work.

2.  David Farber pointed out that you can right click on 
VajTestRunner, select -> Run -> Check Class Path, Edit the project 
path, and add the Project which contains the test you want to run.  
This allows you to Run (with) VajTestRunner specifying the test to 
run through a parameter.  You can't right click on  a package or 
test, but you do get the opening of a browser to the failed test 
class when you double click on a failure (not the stack trace, the 
list above the stack trace). 

VajTestRunner usage:
 -p <package whose AllTests you want to run>
 -c <class to run in JUnit>
 
For test classes in default packages you need to use the Vaj package 
name in double quotes, ie.
 -c "Default package for JUnit Vaj TestRunner Test.TestFailure"

Installation:

Shut down VisualAge for Java
Unzip VajJUnit.zip into your VisualAge for Java ide\tools directory.
Start VisualAge for Java.
Import VajRepository.dat from ide\tools\junit

Notes:

I modified JUnit slightly (hence the 3.5vaj version name), I changed 
the scope of junit.swingui.TestRunner.fTestRunViews from private to 
protected, so I could add a MouseListener to the JList which contains 
the failures.


Erik Meade
emeade@...
subject: Re: Integration with VisualAge for Java
